- Topic: Waiver of Building and Demolition Permit Fees for Hurricane Ida Damaged Structures
- Summary: The ordinance aims to waive certain fees for building and demolition permits required to repair or rebuild structures damaged by Hurricane Ida, excluding cases where renovation or new construction was in progress. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,459
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Motion to Suspend the Rules to receive Motion No. M-21-381 - Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
    Vote 2: Motion to Suspend the Rules to add Motion No. M-21-381 - Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
    Vote 3: Adoption of the Ordinance - Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance to waive certain fees for building and demolition permits in the context of Hurricane Ida damage was adopted.
- UID: 92014c1f-b736-4326-8e62-5bb7979e029a

- Topic: Amendment to Inspector General Appointment Requirements
- Summary: The ordinance aims to reduce the time from four to two years when a former or current official or employee of New Orleans city government, the state, or its political subdivisions may be appointed to inspector general. It also allows certain employees of the office of inspector general of the state or its political subdivisions to be immediately eligible for appointment to inspector general.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,448
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was passed with unanimous support.
- Tags/Keywords: Inspector General, Appointment, Code Amendment
- UID: 480e9b18-1cb6-41b0-8175-c0a79a57045e

- Topic: Creation of "Convenience Centers" and Waste/Recycling Drop-Off Centers
- Summary: The ordinance directs the City Planning Commission to conduct a public hearing to consider amending the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance to create a new use category of "convenience centers" or "waste and recycling drop-off centers" and to establish site design and use standards.
- Ordinance Number: MOTION - NO. M-21-364

    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)

- UID: 480e9b18-1cb6-41b0-8175-c0a79a57045e

- Topic: Off-Street Parking Requirement for Residential Properties
- Summary: The ordinance requires one off-street parking space per new bedroom in residential properties, with exceptions for smaller properties and affordable housing developments. It also limits the number of bathrooms in certain properties.

- Votes Summary:

- Topic: Affordable Housing Sales Price Adjustment
- Summary: The ordinance proposes to adjust the sales price of each affordable unit by adding 5% to the initial sales price for the entire 20-year affordability period, with a requirement to disclose this covenant or deed restriction to prospective buyers. The Board of Zoning Adjustments may consider waivers for off-street parking requirements under this overlay.
- Ordinance Number: M-21-373
- Votes Summary:
